annotation.spannedText: The debate over vaccines and the overwhelming media coverage that it's attracted in light of a measles outbreak tends to obscure a key fact about Americans

classMention.mentionClass: The debate over vaccines and the overwhelming media coverage that it's attracted in light of a measles outbreak tends to obscure a key fact about Americans

annotation.spannedText: Most of the people who've gotten measles in the current outbreak were not vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: Most of the people who've gotten measles in the current outbreak were not vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: Anne Schuchat, the assistant surgeon general and director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases, part of the U.S .Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

classMention.mentionClass: Anne Schuchat, the assistant surgeon general and director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases, part of the U.S .Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

annotation.spannedText: "This is not a problem with the measles vaccine not working. This is a problem of the measles vaccine not being used

classMention.mentionClass: "This is not a problem with the measles vaccine not working. This is a problem of the measles vaccine not being used

annotation.spannedText: Outbreaks generally require two things: an initial spark and enough unvaccinated people to feed the flames

classMention.mentionClass: Outbreaks generally require two things: an initial spark and enough unvaccinated people to feed the flames

annotation.spannedText: a small number of children can be harmed by any vaccination

classMention.mentionClass: a small number of children can be harmed by any vaccination

annotation.spannedText: There's no way to identify ahead of time which few children will be harmed by vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: There's no way to identify ahead of time which few children will be harmed by vaccines

annotation.spannedText: Many of those who avoid vaccines—including some families with children who have autism—worry that their child is particularly vulnerable and will suffer one of the rare cases of harm

classMention.mentionClass: Many of those who avoid vaccines—including some families with children who have autism—worry that their child is particularly vulnerable and will suffer one of the rare cases of harm

annotation.spannedText: The data is very clear in terms of the benefits and lack of risks of these vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: The data is very clear in terms of the benefits and lack of risks of these vaccines

annotation.spannedText: David Yassa, an infectious disease doctor at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Boston

classMention.mentionClass: David Yassa, an infectious disease doctor at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Boston

annotation.spannedText: People who choose not to vaccinate their children are taking a risk both for their own child and for the larger community

classMention.mentionClass: People who choose not to vaccinate their children are taking a risk both for their own child and for the larger community

annotation.spannedText: The more people who are vaccinated, the lower the likelihood that the disease will be passed to someone who is too young to be vaccinated or is otherwise vulnerable to the disease

classMention.mentionClass: The more people who are vaccinated, the lower the likelihood that the disease will be passed to someone who is too young to be vaccinated or is otherwise vulnerable to the disease

annotation.spannedText: Religious and personal exemptions do not endanger other people, as long as roughly 95 percent of the population is vaccinated, creating what's called herd immunity

classMention.mentionClass: Religious and personal exemptions do not endanger other people, as long as roughly 95 percent of the population is vaccinated, creating what's called herd immunity

annotation.spannedText: For those who are fully vaccinated, the risk of contracting measles is very low

classMention.mentionClass: For those who are fully vaccinated, the risk of contracting measles is very low

annotation.spannedText: If the numbers of unvaccinated climb or there are pockets with lower protection, it can lead to outbreaks when the disease arrives from abroad

classMention.mentionClass: If the numbers of unvaccinated climb or there are pockets with lower protection, it can lead to outbreaks when the disease arrives from abroad

annotation.spannedText: Because the disease has been rare since vaccination began more than 50 years ago, most doctors today have never seen a case of measles

classMention.mentionClass: Because the disease has been rare since vaccination began more than 50 years ago, most doctors today have never seen a case of measles
